alert.note: Alert for Dauphin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 11:01AM EST until December 21 at 5:30AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Above Middletown affecting Dauphin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek above Middletown. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor over-bank flooding begins near the Vine Street Bridge downstream to the Susquehanna River. At 12.0 feet, Both banks overflow upstream of the Vine Street Bridge and several basements are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 11.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
